answers.answer:
Medical recovery services can be obtained in sanatoriums, including those with a spa profile, and in sanatorium units within hospitals. These services are provided on an inpatient basis.

To find detailed information, visit the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medical-recovery-in-hospitals and read under the section titled "Medical recovery in hospitals, sanatoriums."

Yes, patients generally need to pay a personal contribution for medical recovery services received in spa sanatoriums. However, beneficiaries of Emergency Ordinance no.15/2022 are exempt from this personal contribution.

You can find this detailed information by visiting the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medical-recovery-in-hospitals and reading under the section "Medical recovery in hospitals, sanatoriums".

For medical recovery services in spa sanatoriums, the period and flow are determined by physical medicine and rehabilitation specialists. For services provided in sanatoriums other than spas and preventive sanatoriums, specialist doctors working in those units establish the period and flow.

To find detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medical-recovery-in-hospitals and read under the section "Medical recovery in hospitals, sanatoriums."

To find the detailed information, go to the website https://dopomoha.ro/en/medical-recovery-in-hospitals and look for the "Guide on the rights of people from the armed conflict zone in Ukraine in the social health insurance system".
